column4: well, it will runt hem, but it requires a bit of hoop jumping

ZeroA4: i'm fairly new to linux, would you say it's difficult to get passed the hurdles? I'm using debian atm and am having lots of trouible getting my 3d drivers to work. I'm just gonna give up until 7.10 comes out
well im' fairly experienced(by no means an expert), and I consdiered it to big of a hassle, and stuck with 32bit
how did you learn so muc about linux? just trial and error?
A LOT of trial and error..lol i thinkt he first few months i must have reinstalled 10-12x..lol
i had to reinstall debian twice after i incorrectly set up my 3d drivers ;\
if you ever want to know how to nuke an install, let me know, i could send you numerous ways...lol
what distro were you using to learn on?
i mostly learned Xandros, then just didn't like it, tried Fedora, used it for about 6mo, then someone turned me on To Kubuntu, which I hated, then I found Ubuntu, and it was love at first site.
using debian atm, not liking it as much i tohguht I would. thinking of trying out Fedora or SUSE on an older comp
well, my personal opinion, having used both of them, Ubuntu kills Fedora/Suse
Debian/Ubuntu has a far superior package manager, IMO
i wouldn't doubt it, but i'd like to get some better linux knowledge on my plate
ya, apt-get is amazing, that's why i tried debian.
o lol, maybe in a year or so
